intro: Metrosideros rubra, commonly known as the New Zealand Christmas tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Māori medicine. The tree is relatively short-lived, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters.
